title-group.article-title: COMPUTING THE SINGULARITIES OF RATIONAL SURFACES

abstract.p: Given a rational projective parametrization ùí´(ùî∞, ùî±, ùî≥) of a rational projective surface S we present an algorithm such that, with the exception of a finite set (maybe empty) ùîÖ of projective base points of ùí´, decomposes the projective parameter plane as ${\mathrm{\mathbb{P}}}^{2}\left(\mathrm{\mathbb{K}}\right)\backslash \text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{B}={\cup }_{\mathrm{\kappa }=1}^{\mathrm{\iota }}{\mathrm{S}}_{\mathrm{\kappa }}$ such that, if (ùî∞‚ÇÄ : ùî±‚ÇÄ : ùî≥‚ÇÄ) ‚àà ùîñk, then ùí´(ùî∞‚ÇÄ, ùî±‚ÇÄ, ùî≥‚ÇÄ) is a point of S of multiplicity k.
